common

Class HeifPropertyInjector

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.HeifPropertyInjector

  • public class HeifPropertyInjector
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides functionality to inject transformative image properties (Mirroring, Clean Aperture, and Pixel Aspect Ratio) into an existing HEIF/HEIC file.

    This class performs binary surgery on the ISO-BMFF structure, managing box size updates, property associations, and file offset shifts to ensure the resulting file remains valid.

      • injectProperties

        public void injectProperties(BoxHandler handler,
                             java.nio.file.Path input,
                             java.nio.file.Path output)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Injects 'imir', 'clap', and 'pasp' properties into the HEIF file.
        Parameters:
        handler - the parsed BoxHandler containing the HEIF structure
        input - the path to the source HEIF file
        output - the path where the modified HEIF file will be saved
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file reading or writing fails

      • updateBoxSize

        private void updateBoxSize(byte[] newData,
                           int origOff,
                           int extra,
                           int ipcoAt,
                           int ipmaAt,
                           int pLen,
                           int aLen)
        Updates the 4-byte size field of a box while accounting for the "double-shift" phenomenon, where the size field itself may have moved due to an injection.
        Parameters:
        newData - the modified file buffer
        origOff - original file offset of the box
        extra - bytes to add to the size
        ipcoAt - offset where properties were injected
        ipmaAt - offset where associations were injected
        pLen - length of the property injection
        aLen - length of the association injection

      • incrementIpmaCount

        private void incrementIpmaCount(byte[] newData,
                                ItemPropertyAssociationBox ipma,
                                int targetID,
                                int added,
                                int ipcoAt,
                                int ipmaAt,
                                int pLen,
                                int aLen)
        Increments the association count for a specific item within the 'ipma' box.

        This is required because we are adding three new properties to the target item. The method first calculates the 'ipma' box's new location in the shifted byte array, then iterates through the item entries to find the targetID and patches the count byte.

        Parameters:
        newData - the modified file buffer containing the injected data
        ipma - the original parsed ItemPropertyAssociationBox for structural reference
        targetID - the ID of the item (usually the Primary Item ID) to update
        added - the number of new properties being associated (e.g., 3)
        ipcoAt - the file offset where the 'ipco' properties were injected
        ipmaAt - the file offset where the 'ipma' associations were injected
        pLen - the byte length of the injected properties
        aLen - the byte length of the injected associations

      • updateIlocOffsets

        private void updateIlocOffsets(BoxHandler handler,
                               byte[] newData,
                               int ipcoAt,
                               int ipmaAt,
                               int pLen,
                               int aLen)
        Audits and updates the 'iloc' (Item Location) box to maintain data integrity. This method performs two critical coordinate shifts: 1. Field Position Shift: If the iloc box itself was located after an injection point, the physical address where we write the offset must be shifted. 2. Offset Value Shift: If the data (EXIF, mdat, etc.) that the offset points to has moved down the file, the value stored in that field must be incremented.
        Parameters:
        handler - the box handler containing the original iloc metadata
        newData - the new byte array being modified
        ipcoAt - the file offset where the 'ipco' properties were injected
        ipmaAt - the file offset where the 'ipma' associations were injected
        pLen - the byte length of the injected properties
        aLen - the byte length of the injected associations

      • createAssociationBlob

        private byte[] createAssociationBlob(ItemPropertyAssociationBox ipma,
                                     int[] indices,
                                     boolean[] essential)
        Generates the correct byte sequence for associations based on the IPMA box configuration.
        Parameters:
        ipma - The existing IPMA box to match version and flags
        indices - array of property indices to associate
        essential - array indicating if each property is essential (must be understood by decoder)
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the association entries

      • findIpmaInsertionPoint

        private int findIpmaInsertionPoint(ItemPropertyAssociationBox ipma,
                                   int targetID)
        Locates the exact byte position within the IPMA box to insert new associations for a target Item ID.

      • createMirrorBox

        private byte[] createMirrorBox(int axis)
        Creates an 'imir' (Image Mirroring) box payload. * @param axis 0 for vertical axis (L-R flip), 1 for horizontal axis (T-B flip)
        Returns:
        Byte array of the imir box.

      • createClapBox

        private byte[] createClapBox(long w,
                             long h,
                             long hOff,
                             long vOff)
        Creates a 'clap' (Clean Aperture) box payload.
        Parameters:
        w - width numerator
        h - height numerator
        hOff - horizontal offset numerator
        vOff - vertical offset numerator
        Returns:
        byte array of the clap box

      • createPaspBox

        private byte[] createPaspBox(long hSpacing,
                             long vSpacing)
        Creates a 'pasp' (Pixel Aspect Ratio) box payload.
        Parameters:
        hSpacing - relative width of a pixel
        vSpacing - relative height of a pixel
        Returns:
        byte array of the pasp box

      • main

        Entry point for the injection process.
